response_parsed.title: Harding REST APIs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer will guide you through the process of securing your REST APIs using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Use of security best practices such as input validation, content security policy, and rate limiting
Implementation of authentication methods like JWT and OAuth
Utilization of FastAPI's built-in features for handling HTTPS and CORS
Leveraging dependency injection for separating concerns and improving maintainability

from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
# Add CORS middleware in your FastAPI app initialization
app = FastAPI()
normal_origin = '*'  # or specific origins as a list

app.add_middleware(CORSMiddleware, allow_origins=normal_origin, allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=['*'], allow_headers=['*'])
